description.narrative: (i) Increased access to affordable and quality telecommunication services, especially in rural areas: The proposed IFC investment will enable the Company to offer improved access to good quality voice and data/internet services to its rural subscribers, which form about 55% of its subscriber base. The Company''s strong rural focus and management capability will enable better access to quality and affordable telecom services in these underserved markets of India. IFC''s investment in Idea will support the Company''s expansion in rural areas. (ii) Raising additional revenue for the GOI and fostering macro-economic development: Continued investment in this sector is expected to have a broad based positive impact on the economy. Idea is expected to make significant direct contributions to the GOI through spectrum payments and taxes. Importantly in a country like India, the telecom sector is known to have a significant multiplier effect on the rest of the economy. The WBG estimates that for every 10% rise in broadband penetration, approximately 1-2% is added to a nation''s GDP.

The Project consists of an equity investment of up to INR 3,893 million (approximately US$65 million) in common shares of Idea Cellular Limited (Idea or the Company), through a Qualified Institutional Placement (QIP) process. The proceeds of the equity investment will be used for meeting business requirements including payment towards spectrum that may be auctioned by DoT in future and for general corporate purpose (the Project).
